data.title: Bob Marley and the Wailers
data.meta_description: Bob Marley and the Wailers were a Jamaican reggae band whose songs "Jamming" ("Cool Runnin'"), "Wings of a Dove" and "Wake Up and Live" ("The Big Thaw") appeared in the show Miami Vice. The band was formed by Bob Marley, originally with Bunny Wailer (born 1947) and Peter Tosh (1944-1987), then...
data.text:
Miami Vice Performer

Former Members

Bob Marley (1945-1981)

Aston Barrett (born 1946)

Carlton Barrett (1950-1987)

Rita Marley (born 1946)

Judy Marwett (born 1952)

Marcia Griffiths (born 1949)

Active

1974-1981

Bob Marley and the Wailers were a Jamaican reggae band whose songs "Jamming" ("Cool Runnin'"), "Wings of a Dove" and "Wake Up and Live" ("The Big Thaw") appeared in the show Miami Vice. The band was formed by Bob Marley, originally with Bunny Wailer (born 1947) and Peter Tosh (1944-1987), then with Aston Barrett and his brother Carlton, and the "I-Threes": Marley's wife Rita, Judy Marwett, and Marcia Griffiths. The group released eight studio albums (along with two live albums) under "Bob Marley and the Wailers" from 1974 until 1983 (included one posthumous album after Marley's death).

Discography[]

Rasta Revolution (1974)

Natty Dread (1974)

Rastaman Vibration (1975)

Exodus (1977, featured the song "Jamming")

Kaya (1978)

Survival (1979, featured the songs "Wake Up and Live" and "Zimbabwe", for the newly independent country formerly called Rhodesia)

Uprising (1980)

Confrontation (1983, released after Marley's 1981 death)

The Wailers continue to tour with original member Aston Barrett, Jr. part of the band.
